entries.text: He was wrong. Very understandably so, since reality, even if it is inevitable, is not completely predictable; those who learn some correct detail about the life of another promptly jump from it to quite incorrect conclusions.
The things people joke about most are usually those which irritate them, but which they do not want to seem to be irritated by.
Each great artist seems so different from all the others, and gives us such a strong sense of individuality, which we seek in vain in everyday life.
But despite the richness of these works, I found myself thinking how strongly these works partake of the character of being incomplete.
The clock had stopped again, yet the room seemed louder for it. Time paused to listen.
entries.note: Possibly metaphorical reference to emotional stagnation.

entries.text: When we name a thing, we give it shape, but not substance.
Some truths are too light to cast a shadow.
entries.note: This line reminds me of Wittgenstein's propositions.

entries.text: Logic is merely the music of reason played in silence.
entries.author: Ludwig Bitgenstein

entries.text: To understand a sentence is to understand its place in the world.
entries.author: Ludwig Bitgenstein

entries.text: The dogmatic world collapsed when the metaphors began to argue.
entries.author: Ludwig Bitgenstein
entries.note: Nonsense quote for testing nested annotation fields.

entries.text: Beyond the river stood a city of mirrors, each reflecting a different dawn.
entries.author: Italo Testone

entries.text: In the silence between footsteps lies the rhythm of eternity.
entries.author: Italo Testone

entries.text: Maybe the mirrors were only there so the city could see itself vanishing.
entries.author: Italo Testone
entries.note: Annotated thought â€” testing mixed highlight types.

entries.text: To build is to forget what once stood.
entries.author: Ada Gearwright

entries.text: The cathedral hums at night when no one prays to it anymore.
entries.author: Ada Gearwright
entries.note: Used to test multi-book annotations and timestamps.
